metadata.title: CVE-2024-36891 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:maple_tree: fix mas_empty_area_rev() null pointer dereference Currently thecode calls mas_start() followed by mas_data_end() if the maple state isMA_START, but mas_start() may return with the maple state node == NULL.This will lead to a null pointer dereference when checking information inthe NULL node, which is done in mas_data_end(). Avoid setting the offset ifthere is no node by waiting until after the maple state is checked for anempty or single entry state. A user could trigger the events to cause akernel oops by unmapping all vmas to produce an empty maple tree, thenmapping a vma that would cause the scenario described above.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-36891` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-40-generic - 6.8.0-40.40
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-40-generic - 6.8.0-40.40
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-40-generic-64k - 6.8.0-40.40
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1013-aws - 6.8.0-1013.14
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1012-azure - 6.8.0-1012.14
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1012-gcp - 6.8.0-1012.13
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-gke - 6.8.0-1008.11
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1010-ibm - 6.8.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-40-lowlatency - 6.8.0-40.40.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-40-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-40.40.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1010-oracle - 6.8.0-1010.10
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1010-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1009-raspi - 6.8.0-1009.10
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1010-oem - 6.8.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-intel - 6.8.0-1009.16
No subscription required

linux-aws package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1013.14').
linux-azure package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1012.14').

linux-intel package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1009.16').
